respond.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
respond.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Responding to the news, Mr Watt appealed for calm.
The US responded by sending troops into Laos.
Villagers responded with offers of help.
respond.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to say or write something as a reply
respond.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He responded that he didn’t want to see anyone.
Dave didn’t respond to any of her emails.
respond.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to improve as a result of a particular kind of treatment
respond.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: She has responded well to treatment.
Colds do not respond to antibiotics.
respond.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to react to something that has happened
respond.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The company responded aggressively by selling market-rate investments.
Overseas exchanges can’t respond as quickly as Wall Street to new product ideas.
Consumers will respond to any recession by buying less.
respond.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to reply to a letter, telephone call etc
respond.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Thousands of readers saw the ad and responded.
We are committed to responding to all customer complaints within 10 days.
